Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Mature Animal Style, pottery chalice; cream slip; interior glazed streaky black with trace of band in added white at bottom of sherd; exterior: perhaps a boar (part of underbelly and part of hindlegs of boar remaining, with added red dots) to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding boars with red spots, see British Museum 1888,0601.466.d-f.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0602) (phase 2)
